content: If you are participating in the SANER track for the May Connectathon, please let me and/or Austin know and what your server address will be/is as soon as possible
Just not feeling the love in this channel...
I'd also love to see the server addresses. (Is that better?)

@David Pyke @Keith Boone I believe during Wednesday's Teams meeting it was mentioned that server URLs would be posted soon. I'm not seeing any in the Teams chat nor any here. Is there somewhere else I should be looking for them?

Thanks.
I'll get the ones I have published this afternooon
@David Pyke Any progress on the URLs?
Tehy've been added to the track in Confluence but I'll add them here

Correction: Ai is http://test.sanerproject.org
I have to work on getting certificate updated for https yet.

@Keith Boone A couple questions:

  1. I think Thomas had asked about location lat/lon coordinates for the MeasureReports. We don't see any in the MeasureReport resource on your server. Is this something in the works for this round, or did we misunderstand?

  2. It looks like the "period" value for the 3386 MeasureReports span only the dates 5/11/2020 - 5/13/2020. Are missing some data or is this what's supposed to be there?

Thanks,
--Mark

Keith Boone said:

Working on that today.

Thanks, Keith. Is there, like last time, an ongoing Teams or Zoom meeting for people to show up and ask questions as needed?
We should (I hope) be able to do that through Whova. @David Pyke and/or @Austin Kreisler , can you verify?
There will be a zoom opened up tomorrow when testing starts and left open for the day

Okay, I pushed an update for the Symptomatic servers yesterday, and they're now available for use. Grab-bag of new features: cron jobs pulling the HHS Protect data on a weekly basis, deduplication algorithms, geocoding pipeline auto-publishes the ICU capacity maps, audited accounts system, geospatial indices, API endpoints for doing HSA lookups, etc.

https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4
Are there docs on how to access this?
This is what I have from postman for Cerner's sandbox endpoint: https://fhir-open.cerner.com/r4/ec2458f2-1e24-41c8-b71b-0e701af7583d/

David Pyke said:

Fantastic!

Apologies, the base Url is https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4. Should be able to discover all capabilities via the /metadata route, and it should support all SANER functionalities, per the Inferno test server.

GET https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4/metadata
GET https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4/Organization
GET https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4/Measure
GET https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4/MeasureReport

PUT/POST https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4/Organization
PUT/POST https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4/Measure
PUT/POST https://saner.symptomatic.us/baseR4/MeasureReport
